‚ÄúI think we should. I mean, I agree with the love of humanity, and we should definitely try‚Ä¶

retweet.text:
Elon Musk on philanthropy: 

‚ÄúI think we should. I mean, I agree with the love of humanity, and we should definitely try to do things that help our fellow human beings. But it‚Äôs very hard.

If you care about the reality of goodness rather than simply the perception of it, it‚Äôs extremely difficult to give away money well.

I have a large foundation, but I don‚Äôt put my name on it. In fact, I‚Äôve said I don‚Äôt want my name on anything. The biggest challenge I find with the foundation is trying to give money away in a way that is truly beneficial to people.

It‚Äôs very easy to give money away in a way that creates the appearance of goodness. It is very difficult‚Äîextremely difficult‚Äîto give money away for the reality of goodness.‚Äù

quoted.text:
üá∫üá∏ ELON: DOGE IS STILL QUIETLY SAVING HUNDREDS OF BILLIONS

They're requiring 2 tiny fields on every federal payment:  

1. A proper congressional authorization code  
2. A comment field that actually says something

That's it.

And suddenly, hundreds of billions in pure fraud and waste just... stops.

Before DOGE, massive payments were flying out the door with both fields completely blank, making real audits literally impossible.

That's why the Pentagon has failed every single audit for decades: the data doesn't even exist.

Elon: "Fraudsters don't confess. They scream that you're hurting children in Africa."

Then DOGE asks for the wiring instructions.

"Oh it's going to Deloitte & Touche in Washington DC... Okay, cool, can we just talk to the actual kids in Africa?"

Crickets.

The best part? When you block the scam, the grifters instantly spin up sob stories and accuse you of being heartless.

This isn't complicated rocket science.

It's basic financial hygiene that any normal company does on day one.

Yet the federal government never did it... until Elon and DOGE showed up.

The swamp is absolutely seething.

Source: @nikhilkamathcio, @elonmusk

tweets.text:
RT @MarioNawfal: ELON: "X ISN'T THE BIGGEST PLATFORM, BUT IT RUNS THE GLOBAL CONVERSATION"

Elon gave the most grounded take on X's place i‚Ä¶

retweet.text:
ELON: "X ISN'T THE BIGGEST PLATFORM, BUT IT RUNS THE GLOBAL CONVERSATION"

Elon gave the most grounded take on X's place in the world during the Nikhil Kamath podcast:

"I mean, look, on the internet, I'm small, you know.

Essentially, what percentage of internet is spent on Twitter? Is there a number to it? On X?

Well, so we have like about 600 million monthly users.

Although it can spike up if there's some major event in the world. It can get up to, I don't know, 800 million or a billion if there's some major event in the world.

So there's, I don't know, 250, 300 million per week type of thing. It's a pretty decent number."

He's not chasing TikTok teens or Instagram reels, X is the home for the literate, the deep thinkers, the ones who actually read and argue ideas.

Video is growing fast, but the core superpower is text. And that's not changing.

In a world drowning in short-form dopamine, X is the last fortress of long-form thought.

And it's still pulling a billion people when shit hits the fan. Small? Nah. Just elite.

Source: @nikhilkamathcio, @elonmusk

tweets.text:
RT @MarioNawfal: ELON'S POV ON THE MEANING OF LIFE: "IT'S ABOUT THE QUESTION, NOT THE ANSWER"

Elon is literally saying the entire purpose‚Ä¶

retweet.text:
ELON'S POV ON THE MEANING OF LIFE: "IT'S ABOUT THE QUESTION, NOT THE ANSWER"

Elon is literally saying the entire purpose of human existence, and everything he's building, from Neuralink and Starship to Grok and Optimus, is aimed at one goal.

What's the goal, you ask? To turn humanity into a massive superintelligence that can finally figure out the right questions to ask reality itself.

"Humans are 30~40 trillion cells, trillions of synapses‚Ä¶ but the why of it is just so we can increase our understanding of the universe.

I came to the conclusion, Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy style, that the answer is 42, but the real problem is we don't even know what the question is.

The hard part is the question, not the answer.

And for that you need a much bigger computer than Earth.

So by expanding the scope and scale of consciousness, we can better understand what questions to ask about the answer that is the universe."

He's literally saying the entire purpose of human existence, and everything he's building (Neuralink, Starship, Grok, Optimus), is to turn humanity into a massive superintelligence that can finally figure out the right questions to ask reality itself.

Not to get the answer. To learn how to ask the question that makes the answer meaningful.

This is why he doesn't give a damn about money, politics, or fame anymore.

He's playing the longest game in history: 

Turning consciousness into a galaxy-scale instrument so we can finally understand why anything exists at all.

Source: @nikhilkamathcio, @elonmusk

I‚Äôll tell you all a secret‚Ä¶ well, sort of a secret‚Ä¶

Most of us black folk who have escaped the hood and live in better neighborhoods stay ALL THEE WAY THE HELL OUT of high crime black neighborhoods.

I still have family in Far Rockaway, Queens and we either have to meet at a neutral point, or they have to drive out to me. I stopped going anywhere near their neighborhood, especially if I have my wife and daughter with me.

Until that happens, the fatigue will grow and spread.

tweets.text: Yeah

quoted.text:
Elon Musk: ‚ÄúAnyone who wants to make more than they take has my respect‚Äù

Elon is asked for his advice for entrepreneurs, to which he responds:

‚ÄúI‚Äôm a big fan of anyone who wants to build. Anyone who wants to make more than they take has my respect. That‚Äôs the main thing you should aim for: to make more than you take and be a net contributor to society.‚Äù

He compares it to the pursuit of happiness:

‚ÄúIf you want to create something valuable financially, you don‚Äôt pursue that. It‚Äôs best to pursue providing useful products and services. If you do that, money will come as a natural consequence of that rather than pursuing money directly. You can‚Äôt pursue happiness directly. You pursue things that lead to happiness ‚Äî fulfilling work, study, friends, loved ones.‚Äù

Elon continues:

‚ÄúIt sounds very obvious, but generally if somebody is trying to make a company work, they should expect to grind super hard and accept that there‚Äôs a meaningful chance of failure. Then just focus on having the output be worth more than the input. Are you a value creator? That‚Äôs what really matters: making more than you take.‚Äù

Video source: @nikhilkamathcio (2025)
